element.name: Bigby Presents: Glory of the Giants
element.source: Bigby Presents: Glory of the Giants

description.p: Contains the Path of the Giant Barbarian subclass content.

element.name: Path of the Giant
element.source: Bigby Presents: Glory of the Giants

description.p: Barbarians who follow the Path of the Giant draw strength from the primordial forces of the giants, channeling their might and stature in battle.

element.name: Giant Power
element.source: Bigby Presents: Glory of the Giants

description.p: Starting when you choose this path at 3rd level, you learn to speak, read, and write Giant. You also learn the Thaumaturgy cantrip. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

element.name: Giant’s Havoc
element.source: Bigby Presents: Glory of the Giants

description.p: When you rage, you can channel the might of giants, growing in size. You become Large if you were Medium or smaller, along with anything you’re wearing. Your weapons also grow to match your new size. If there isn’t enough room for you to become Large, your size doesn’t change.
While raging in this way, your reach increases by 5 feet, and your thrown weapons deal extra damage equal to your Rage Damage bonus.

element.name: Elemental Cleaver
element.source: Bigby Presents: Glory of the Giants

description.p: At 6th level, you can infuse one weapon with elemental power. When you rage, choose one element: fire, cold, acid, lightning, or thunder. Your weapon deals an extra 1d6 damage of the chosen type while raging.

element.name: Mighty Impel
element.source: Bigby Presents: Glory of the Giants

description.p: At 10th level, you gain the ability to hurl creatures. As a bonus action, you can choose a creature that is your size or smaller within 5 feet of you and throw it up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw or land prone.

element.name: Demiurgic Colossus
element.source: Bigby Presents: Glory of the Giants

description.p: At 14th level, your transformation while raging grows further. You can now become Huge if you were Large or smaller, and your reach increases by 10 feet. The extra damage from your Elemental Cleaver feature increases to 2d6.
